Description: Body sherd of Attic, possibly black-figured, pottery band-cup; interior glazed (fired brown); exterior: lip glazed, handle zone reserved with inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
There is no evidence of black figure related incision on the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 412, no. B633)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0494) (Phase 1)
